description:
// Anat Dean - Esoteric Languages

Coding languages are often used because they are easy to understand, but what happens when you tip that on its head and code using the most difficult tools to read and follow? Piet is a programming language built using blocks of colour to execute instructions. This will be a brief intro into the "wild west" of Piet and how esoteric languages can inform how we think about learning to code.

// About Anat
Anat is a lecturer of full stack web development at Northcoders bootcamp in Manchester. She loves design and UI and is an advocate for improving diversity and representation in tech.

// Panelists: Mike Oram + Aleo Yakas

// About Mike:
Mike Oram is the lead trainer at Mayden Academy. He is a full stack developer with over ten years’ experience working in interface design, front-end and server-side technologies. Mike most enjoys writing JavaScript and has a particular passion for mentoring and supporting junior developers

// About Aleo
Aleo is a Junior Software Developer at Creditsafe. He started his journey into technology in September 2019 when he took the _nology 12 week bootcamp. Aleo is most confident with React; however, currently he is exploring backend technologies as this is where his interests lie. In his free time, he is learning C# and .NET Framework, allowing him to workout outside his role and pick up smaller backend tickets.
title: BRISTECH: BYTESIZE #7 -  ANAT DEAN - ESOTERIC LANGUAGES + PANEL DISCUSSION
